p: For clinical assessment, patients were evaluated on days 1 (study enrollment), 6, and 10. Influenza signs and symptoms were assessed by investigators at each center using a 4-point scale [ 15]. Temperature (oral or tympanic) and adverse events (AEs) were recorded daily on diary cards. In the last 2 years of the study, baseline and follow-up symptom assessments were conducted by the study physicians, but diary cards were not obtained.
